intro: Hieracium bupleuroides subsp. schenkii, commonly known as the Schenk’s hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has finely divided, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some regions.
